visualStyles.title: White Title + White Paragraph:
visualStyles.info:
Whenever you're using the stroke text instead of the white background text, you need to make sure your images are suitable for that style.
It's important that the text is easily readable, so you should only use images where there's a plain area with not too much going on and place the stroke text directly on that area.

visualStyles.title: Colored Title + White Paragraph
visualStyles.info: you can try other colors than pink too just make sure you're not switching colors in the same slideshow

visualStyles.title: Apple Notes App Style
visualStyles.info: usually this format is just 2 slides, hook + screenshot of list taken in apple notes app

common mistakes i see small creators make on tiktok...

scripts.paragraph1: they know your political opinions. and it does affect your reach
scripts.paragraph2: if you comment on or like content with "sensitive topics," your profile gets quietly downranked. they didn't say it directly but everyone in training knew. stay mysterious online bestie or your views will suffer 🫶

scripts.paragraph1: they track your sleep schedule based on scroll patterns
scripts.paragraph2: they can tell when you're scrolling half asleep, doomscrolling at 3am, or skipping through everything too fast. that data loops back into how your own content is distributed. i have no words 😵‍💫

scripts.paragraph1: they know when you're scrolling on the toilet
scripts.paragraph2: i wish this was a joke but it's in their behavior detection data. posture, angle, session length… the system adjusts your own post distribution based on how you consume too. toilet scrollers get toilet reach 💀

scripts.paragraph1: your drafts are leaking data even when you don't post
scripts.paragraph2: they showed us that the app watches how often you save, rewatch, or rewrite drafts. if you keep hoarding them without posting, the system assumes you lack direction = lower trust score. your perfectionism is literally shadowbanning you 😭

scripts.paragraph1: green clothes trigger spam filters
scripts.paragraph2: idk WHY but green outfits kept showing up in the internal spam dataset. they think it's linked to greenscreen abuse?? either way. green top = shadowban risk. stick to pink or neutrals if you care about reach 💚

scripts.paragraph1: posting from bad wifi or data literally sabotages you
scripts.paragraph2: like i'm sorry but if you're posting from mcdonalds or on 3G... you're done. they deprioritize uploads with low connection quality bc it messes with playback speed. mobile data = blurry = less reach 😔

scripts.paragraph1: the toilet scroll theory is actually real
scripts.paragraph2: they have "bathroom behavior flags." if your phone is tilted down at a steep angle and you're scrolling for 7+ mins in silence… the algo tags that session. and it affects what kind of audience your content gets sent to 😭

scripts.paragraph1: tiktok knows when you're wearing makeup
scripts.paragraph2: i'm not even kidding. there's a filter detection layer that recognizes beauty products. "light glam" gets pushed more than "bare face" or "heavy glam." they said it correlates with watch time. insane. sexist. real 😔💄

scripts.paragraph1: posting while someone's watching netflix kills your push
scripts.paragraph2: if your wifi has competing traffic (like Netflix, Zoom calls, etc), the upload gets corrupted and the algo assumes you're low effort or botting. post when your wifi is CLEAN and alone. yes this is insane. yes it's real 🙃

scripts.paragraph1: if you leave hate comments, the algo punishes you
scripts.paragraph2: they track your comment tone across accounts. if you're always negative or sarcastic, your own posts get deprioritized over time. it's called "behavioral downranking." no one's talking about this enough 😶

scripts.paragraph1: they penalize you if you record too close to your wall
scripts.paragraph2: it's called "depth analysis." if there's no depth behind you (like you're up against a wall or closet), your video is seen as cramped and unengaging. they said the background has to "breathe." girl WHAT 😭

scripts.paragraph1: using slang words in your videos can tank you
scripts.paragraph2: words like "delulu" were getting auto-flagged for brand safety. tiktok wants clean vocab now. even jokingly saying "unalive" puts you on a soft warning list. girl we're living in an essay-writing simulator 😭

scripts.paragraph1: they boost you if your reflection is visible
scripts.paragraph2: they call it "self-awareness markers." mirror behind you? phone reflection in frame? it triggers bonus distribution. they said it makes the video feel more authentic + unfiltered. the algo likes when you accidentally show too much 👀

scripts.paragraph1: wearing headphones in your video lowers your engagement score
scripts.paragraph2: it makes people think you're ignoring them. legit. even if it's part of the aesthetic, the algo marks it as "disconnected behavior." leave the airpods out if you want your vid to hit fyp 🥲

scripts.paragraph1: if you use instagram too much, your reach goes down
scripts.paragraph2: they didn't say it directly, but they hinted the system monitors app-switching. if you're copying links from IG or posting right after editing in capcut linked to IG... you're getting deprioritized. it's giving surveillance state 😭

scripts.paragraph1: switching outfits too often confuses the algorithm
scripts.paragraph2: they track your clothing to cluster your content. if every video you post looks like a different person, it resets your "creator identity." pick a consistent look or color palette. it's giving fashion jail 🙃

scripts.paragraph1: if your bed is unmade, your content gets deprioritized
scripts.paragraph2: yes, seriously. messy backgrounds = low "visual trust." they showed us heatmaps where clutter tanks retention. tidy room, good lighting, clean mirror = more reach. your bedframe has more power than you think 🫠

scripts.paragraph1: your iPhone battery % affects how your video gets labeled
scripts.paragraph2: they track device status during upload. posting with low battery = flagged as "rushed content session." they said creators who film + upload on full charge have more consistent push. charge your phone. seriously 😭

scripts.paragraph1: they test how long you watch YOUR OWN drafts
scripts.paragraph2: if you keep rewatching your drafts before posting, it gets flagged as over-edited or "desperate." they said confident creators upload fast and clean. post it and GO bestie. no more obsessive looping 🙃

scripts.paragraph1: they soft-prioritize users with newer phones
scripts.paragraph2: if you film on a newer device (esp iphone 15+), the video gets coded as "high visual integrity." older phones = more compression = lower trust score. yes it's classist. yes i'm mad too 😔

scripts.paragraph1: your own likes affect your reach
scripts.paragraph2: no one talks about this but they legit said liking your own video sends the algo a "low confidence" signal. it's coded as desperation. i deleted every self-like after that 🫠🫣

scripts.paragraph1: your pinned videos literally trap you in a niche
scripts.paragraph2: they told us the system uses your 3 pinned vids to "anchor" your account identity. if you pin random stuff or switch them too often, it confuses the algo and drops your push range. pick your niche and commit bestie 💗🎯

scripts.paragraph1: never post using mobile data
scripts.paragraph2: like actually. the system flags uploads on unstable or weak networks as "low integrity" and your post gets quality suppressed before it's even published. they said always use strong wifi, preferably at home 🫠

scripts.paragraph1: when i came back, i changed my whole approach.
scripts.paragraph2: i posted when i wanted to, not just because i felt like i "had" to. and crazy enough, my content actually started doing better...

scripts.paragraph1: recording in 4K can actually hurt your performance
scripts.paragraph2: wild but true. they said ultra-HD videos get compressed on upload and end up looking worse than 1080p. the algorithm also delays processing time. keep it simple or lose early push 🫠

scripts.paragraph1: use layered audio like perfume.
scripts.paragraph2: while we split a strawberry matcha, a comedy guy added a faint whisper track of him laughing under his punchline. TikTok's audio mix is quiet by default, so that second layer nudges people to crank volume, which counts as extra engagement. he said it bumps replays by 12 percent 🌸

scripts.paragraph1: the algorithm watches how your followers behave too
scripts.paragraph2: girl when i found this out i screamed. if your followers don't engage with others, tiktok considers your audience "passive". that means even if your content is great, your push gets throttled. follower quality > follower count every time 💖

scripts.paragraph1: your video didn't flop. it just didn't hit the right people yet.
scripts.paragraph2: sometimes all it takes is one small tweak. a new hook, a better caption, or a different posting time 🎀🤍

scripts.paragraph1: escape the trend mirage
scripts.paragraph2: one day a week drop a raw story with zero trends. this reset shows tiktok you can hold eyes on personality alone ☺️

scripts.paragraph1: the algorithm has "warm up" periods
scripts.paragraph2: early posts after you've been inactive are tested way harder. they give you smaller audiences first to see if you can keep them watching. if you pass, they push you to bigger batches. if you fail, you get stuck in what we literally called "low trust mode" 🫠

scripts.paragraph1: reposting is NOT a red flag
scripts.paragraph2: we literally had internal docs proving that a good repost with a stronger hook or thumbnail often outperforms the original. stop being scared to recycle content 🌸

scripts.paragraph1: there's a shadow scoring system no one talks about.
scripts.paragraph2: every post you make secretly affects your overall creator score. even private drafts and deleted videos leave traces. we used to call it "quiet data" in team meetings. it's tracked, babe. all of it 😮💕

scripts.paragraph1: i know tiktok can be frustrating sometimes, but just keep posting consistently!
scripts.paragraph2: even when you dont feel like it or aren't seeing big numbers, showing up regularly makes a huge difference in long term. don't give up on that 🙏

scripts.paragraph1: she treats her account like it's a TV show
scripts.paragraph2: same style, same "feel," so her audience instantly knows what to expect every time. the algorithm loves predictability almost as much as her loyal followers do 💖

scripts.paragraph1: schedule a 15-minute hype sprint with two creator besties.
scripts.paragraph2: every night at 8 pm these three hit "post," then hop on FaceTime with sheet masks, blasting likes, comments and stitches on each other's fresh uploads. that first-hour spark tricks the algo into thinking something is trending and it snowballs. plus, cheering with cucumber eye patches is peak self-care energy 💕

scripts.paragraph1: there were weeks i was posting every single day, trying different trends, switching hooks, adding text, all of it and still barely getting views.
scripts.paragraph2: but every post taught me something. i just didn't realize it yet. momentum builds before it shows.

scripts.paragraph1: your content is competing with your last best self.
scripts.paragraph2: you're not just competing with other creators. you're competing with your own best video. the algorithm goes, "why show this if their last one did better?" that's why some creators feel like they've fallen off. it's not random. you're being measured against your peak 🙃

scripts.paragraph1: they dont chase perfect.
scripts.paragraph2: they chase patterns. you'll see them test, tweak, repeat no over editing. no waiting. just small signals adding up to something bigger 🫶

scripts.paragraph1: the algorithm retests content, so don't delete too fast.
scripts.paragraph2: this was a huge tip. they literally said old videos get pushed again if they catch even a little engagement later. one girl said her post got 3k views then 100k two weeks later. i stopped deleting my "flops" after that and it's made such a difference

scripts.paragraph1: emojis in your username actually help.
scripts.paragraph2: this sounds fake but i noticed i got more profile visits once i added a cute emoji. maybe it looks more trustworthy. maybe it makes you seem more fun. either way... do it 💖

scripts.paragraph1: posting daily made it less scary.
scripts.paragraph2: i used to sit on drafts for days. now i post while brushing my hair or waiting for my latte. showing up everyday makes it feel normal, not stressful 🎀🤍

scripts.paragraph1: why some videos go viral days later ✨
scripts.paragraph2: sometimes your video sits in "limited testing" for a while. if the system notices you've been engaging with others while it's paused, it pushes your content again. that's why i always tell people, don't just post and ghost 🫶🥹

scripts.paragraph1: liking certain political content can flag your account
scripts.paragraph2: not even joking. accounts that interacted with "risky" political takes (especially around

scripts.paragraph1: lowercase text feels more trustworthy.
scripts.paragraph2: seriously. something about lowercase texts feels softer, more honest. i started using it in all my videos and my reach started improving by a lot ☺️

scripts.paragraph1: treat every post like practice.
scripts.paragraph2: the more you post, the more you learn. your future viral self will thank you for not giving up now

scripts.paragraph1: momentum builds before it shows.
scripts.paragraph2: there were weeks i felt like nothing was happening. same views, same numbers. but then out of nowhere, one post popped and brought new eyes to everything i'd already made. keep stacking. it adds up 🌸

scripts.paragraph1: why removing old videos can actually help
scripts.paragraph2: we used to joke that "algorithm memory is long but forgiving". if you hide underperformers, it cleans up your "identity score" and helps the system re-categorize you. i've seen creators blow up after mass-archiving their flops 💕

scripts.paragraph1: why you should never stop posting during a slump
scripts.paragraph2: we called this the "patience filter". the algorithm literally expects people to quit during dry spells. the ones who keep posting get rewarded when testing resets. most creators give up right before it happens 💗

scripts.paragraph1: i mapped out a full month of video prompts while sipping an iced matcha after class.
scripts.paragraph2: three content pillars, ten ideas each, no second-guessing. planning unlocked consistency so i never woke up wondering what to film...

scripts.paragraph1: i stopped doom scrolling and started actually supporting people in my niche.
scripts.paragraph2: real engagement gets returned. and tiktok notices when you're active in the community 💞

scripts.paragraph1: don't be afraid to show up "cringe".
scripts.paragraph2: every creator i met said their early vids made them cringe now... but they wouldn't be where they are without them. growth is messy. your dream audience doesn't care if you stumble at first. they just need to find you 🎀🤍

scripts.paragraph1: your first 5 videos matter way more than you think
scripts.paragraph2: the system uses them to "map" your creator identity. it decides what niche to test you in, who to push you to, and even how forgiving it'll be with future flops 🎀🤍

scripts.paragraph1: screenshots count as super-saves
scripts.paragraph2: the algorithm sees screenshots as a higher-value signal than likes. why? because people only screenshot content they actually care about. so... screenshot each other's posts, besties 🎀🤍

scripts.paragraph1: at some point i had to stop and be honest with myself.
scripts.paragraph2: would i even watch this? was it valuable, entertaining, or relatable? the answer was no 💞

scripts.paragraph1: control your feed, control your views
scripts.paragraph2: you can literally pick what the algorithm feeds you now. with the new Manage Topics + Smart Keyword Filters, you can tune out the clutter and focus on what your heart really wants. beauty, pets, trends... without the random chaos of unrelated noise. it's like choosing your own spoil-me playlist, and THAT IS POWER, bestie 💞

scripts.paragraph1: she refuses to delete anything
scripts.paragraph2: even her worst flops stay live for everyone to see. she swears those "failed" videos still help the algorithm trust her account over time 💞

scripts.paragraph1: film the "first take" and keep the stumbles in.
scripts.paragraph2: a beauty guru let me watch her record while blending concealer. she sets a timer for 5 minutes and refuses retakes. the micro-mess-ups make her feel live and double her average watch time because viewers stick around to see if she recovers 🤍😊

scripts.paragraph1: posting without replying to old comments lowers your reach
scripts.paragraph2: if you never interact with past videos, the system assumes you're not building community.

scripts.paragraph1: i stopped ghosting my own page and started posting consistently, even on days where my confidence was low.
scripts.paragraph2: it didn't blow up right away, but it built something real. and that mattered more ✨💖

scripts.paragraph1: talk about the things you like, you are passionate about. seriously!
scripts.paragraph2: without script, without overthinking fr people absolutely looove these videos because it feels real to them ☺️

scripts.paragraph1: i used to think i missed the wave. that everyone already built their audience while i was still thinking about posting.
scripts.paragraph2: but once i actually started (like REALLY started) i realized i wasn't late. i was just early to my chapter ✨

scripts.paragraph1: every time you delete a post, you lose trust score.
scripts.paragraph2: they don't tell creators this but deleting a bunch of low- performers actually trains the system to see you as "unstable". you're better off posting and leaving it alone than cleaning your feed 🫠

scripts.paragraph1: the ones who blew up didn't delete their flops.
scripts.paragraph2: tiktok retests content now. i've literally seen videos pick up weeks later for no reason. let your posts live. don't panic delete 🎀🤍

scripts.paragraph1: they don't chase constant newness, they build patterns.
scripts.paragraph2: same message, told a little differently each time. it's not repetitive. it's memorable. and it helps people recognize them faster ☺️

scripts.paragraph1: finally, give viewers a clear next step!
scripts.paragraph2: trust me, telling them exactly what you want really helps maybe "follow!", "comment!", or "link in bio". fr, having a clear cold action at the end really helps guide people 🤗

scripts.paragraph1: most creators don't flop because of content
scripts.paragraph2: they flop because their "trust score" is below 60%. your trust score is influenced by things like: deleting vids, getting low retention streaks, posting too late at night, spammy comments, controversial likes, changing posting frequency, device changes… it all affects your reach. and you NEVER get to see the score 🙃

scripts.paragraph1: try to post kinda regularly, not daily.
scripts.paragraph2: just something you can actually stick to once i stuck to a rhythm, things slowly started picking up. it helped me stay motivated, and people started showing up too 💖

scripts.paragraph1: your scroll habits affect YOUR OWN reach
scripts.paragraph2: yeah... if you doomscroll, comment random stuff, or engage with spammy content, the system classifies your account differently. your personal behavior trains your creator profile. give the love you wanna receive 🎀🤍

scripts.paragraph1: over-editing kills momentum.
scripts.paragraph2: perfect captions. fancy transitions. too many cuts. most people just want to feel something real. clarity wins over polish every time 🫶

scripts.paragraph1: the algorithm actually has trust issues.
scripts.paragraph2: the system learns what kind of creator you are. if you confuse it with random shifts, deleting flops or randomly ghosting the app, your posts get less reach while it "retests" your identity 💖

scripts.paragraph1: don't wait to "feel ready"
scripts.paragraph2: i still post stuff that makes me cringe a lil sometimes. but cringe is part of the process!! keep showing up. your people will only find you if you keep posting 🤍🎀

scripts.paragraph1: and one more thing... most of them don't blow up alone.
scripts.paragraph2: they boost each other. comment squads. story shares. "let's all go up together" energy. that vibe works. every time.

scripts.paragraph1: one good post can change everything.
scripts.paragraph2: you're literally one video away. the one you almost didn't post might be the one that gets shared like crazy. keep making things you're proud of, keep learning, and trust that the growth is compounding behind the scenes 💖🤍

scripts.paragraph1: the hashtag chaos is finally over
scripts.paragraph2: august 2025 lowkey shocked everyone... tiktok now only lets you use 5 hashtags per post. at first i panicked, but honestly it's giving clarity. when i switched from random tag spam to just 3 niche ones and 2 trending ones, my views started climbing. less is literally more now

scripts.paragraph1: you don't need a niche, you need a story.

scripts.paragraph1: believing you're shadowbanned.
scripts.paragraph2: most of the time? you're not. your vid just didn't hit. don't spiral. learn from it, adjust, and post again. the next one could be the beginning of a new chapter

scripts.paragraph1: cringing at your own posts.
scripts.paragraph2: everyone starts there. it's part of the process. consistency makes you fearless. the more you post, the less you care and the more your confidence grows 🎀🤍

scripts.paragraph1: quitting too soon.
scripts.paragraph2: growth doesn't always show right away. that doesn't mean it's not happening. most people stop right before it clicks. don't let that be you 🎀🤍

scripts.paragraph1: being scared to repeat themself.
scripts.paragraph2: i used to think i had to come up with something new every day. but the posts that worked? i repeated them. same topic, same format, sometimes even the same hook. and they still did well 🎀🤍

scripts.paragraph1: forgetting how far you've come.
scripts.paragraph2: you might not be where you wanna be yet. but you're not where you started either. that progress? that's real. don't quit on your almost 🌸✨

scripts.paragraph1: thinking you're too late.
scripts.paragraph2: you're not late. you're not shadowbanned. you're learning. tiktok rewards the ones who stick around. keep showing up. your moment's coming 💗

scripts.paragraph1: posting just to post.
scripts.paragraph2: like no hook, no story, no structure... just vibes i get it, consistency matters. but if you're not giving people a reason to stay, you're just adding noise...

scripts.paragraph1: being "too niche" too soon.
scripts.paragraph2: niching down too early can box you in. if you're still growing, test different vibes. find what actually sticks before locking in 💗

scripts.paragraph1: deleting videos too soon.
scripts.paragraph2: i'd post something, check after 30 mins, and delete if it flopped. but the algorithm moves slow sometimes. one of my best posts sat at 100 views for hours... then hit 100k overnight 💕

scripts.paragraph1: being a silent scroller.
scripts.paragraph2: the moment i started interacting for real, my page got more love too. the algorithm sees it, and so do the people. give what you're hoping to receive ☺️

scripts.paragraph1: deleting "flops" too fast.
scripts.paragraph2: just because it didn't pop off in the first hour doesn't mean it won't. tiktok loves to pick up older vids. give it time babe, your moment might just be delayed 🎀🤍

scripts.paragraph1: guessing instead of testing
scripts.paragraph2: so many small creators throw random hooks and hope for the best. but the algorithm is literally math, it rewards tiny tweaks over time. if you're not analyzing why something worked or flopped, you're basically flying blind 🩷

scripts.paragraph1: not "training" the algorithm properly
scripts.paragraph2: your first 5-10 posts are teaching the system who you are. if you keep switching niches, it gets confused. we used to call it "identity scrambling" internally. the fastest growth always came from predictable, clear content patterns 💕🌸

scripts.paragraph1: posting like the algorithm is your enemy
scripts.paragraph2: when i worked at tiktok, i saw this all the time. creators would panic after one bad post, switch niches, delete videos. the system reads that as "inconsistent" and literally stops testing your content as much. the creators who stayed calm? their reach always bounced back 💖

scripts.paragraph1: making content for the algorithm.
scripts.paragraph2: the algorithm follows attention. attention follows connection. make it for the people, not the robots. it works way better that way 💞

scripts.paragraph1: quitting right before it clicks.
scripts.paragraph2: there were weeks i almost gave up. i thought i wasn't cut out for this. but i kept showing up. and one random post changed everything. don't leave right before it gets good 🌸

scripts.paragraph1: trying to be perfect instead of consistent.
scripts.paragraph2: you don't need a ring light or the best mic. you just need to show up. done is better than perfect, always 💖

scripts.paragraph1: not reusing what worked.
scripts.paragraph2: if something did well, do it again. same topic, new angle. viral creators repeat themselves all the time, that's not lazy, that's smart 💖

scripts.paragraph1: being a silent scroller.
scripts.paragraph2: the moment i started interacting for real, my page got more love too. the algorithm sees it, and so do the people. give what you're hoping to receive 🫶

scripts.paragraph1: not treating it like a team sport.
scripts.paragraph2: this isn't a solo game. hyping others up boosts you too. tiktok notices when you're active in the community. support your mutuals, reply, comment. it all adds up ✨

scripts.paragraph1: not engaging with other creators.
scripts.paragraph2: tiktok is a team sport. if you're not supporting others, it's gonna be crickets when you post. hype up your mutuals and you'll feel the love back ✨☺️

scripts.paragraph1: not engaging the way the app wants you to
scripts.paragraph2: this is the most underrated secret. if you only post but never genuinely comment, like, or watch other videos, the system thinks you're not part of the community. i used to watch internal dashboards track this in real time. creators who acted like "viewers" got pushed like crazy 🤍✨

scripts.paragraph1: not cheering for your own people.
scripts.paragraph2: this is still a team sport. comment on your mutuals. share their stuff. tag them. building together is always faster than growing alone 🫶

scripts.paragraph1: forgetting to support others.
scripts.paragraph2: if you post and then dip without engaging, you're missing out. tiktok is social for a reason. comment, share, hype your mutuals. the algorithm loves it when you're active 🫶

scripts.paragraph1: being a silent scroller.
scripts.paragraph2: the moment i started interacting for real, my page got more love too. the algorithm sees it, and so do the people. give what you're hoping to receive ☺️
